lines: - date range four five days later
- buffer ten minutes after previous event
- always start with the market then the offer
- less niches more focus and profit
- the offer is eighty percent of the success
- understanding and leveraging their core drives
- recognising their goal a desire future state someone has
- defining and understanding the obstacles to said desired state
- creating and recognising pain created by the problem
- eliciting decisions and actions that alleviate pain created by problems
- building confidence in the persons perception of your ability to solve
- create all the rest as they are innate in their mind
- expose and amplify pain that already exists
- encourage and elicit action channelling emotions to act
- certain to be able to solve the problem for them
- the offer is a reflection of your confidence
3. unconscious having what isnt wanted (debt, excess body fat, lonely)
4. unconscious wanting what isnt had ($1,000,000, abs, relationship)
5. conscious bad consequences (being broke, feeling tired, being unloved)
- conscious sources are the easiest to focus on (problems and consequences)
- to amplify pain you must be descrete, be indirect, not direct
- four ways to indirectly amplify pain
4. create seriousness (explaining the weight of their situation and the consequences)
- (pain% plus confidence%) div 2 -> chance of action
- create so much pain and confidence that you force them to take action
- you can create confidence and pain by removing doubt and comfort
- people buy stuff to go A -> B
- position yourself as a staircase in the gap
- your offer must be a vehicle for change (close the gap)
- offer is the way a product or service is positioned
- find out how strong or weak your answer
- the market choose the strength by comparing with competition
- position in your product in a way to create a category of 1
- dont let them compare your product with competition
- frame it to make it look better than others
- weak -> i sell a course that contains videos explaining how to get client
- string -> i sell an easily installed client acquisition infrastructure, pre-built for you
by experts who have already solved the problem for themselves
- 90% of people dont understand offer creation
1. offers succeed when they inspire certainty and position products as vehicles or pathways
to escape current situations and schieve desired ones
2. offers succed when they are unique and force the market to perceive a product or business
in a different, better way to competition. niches and markets dont saturate, offers do.
3. a product is not an offer
4. a service is not an offer
5. a guarantee is not an offer
6. a discount is not an offer
7. a price is not an offer
- a good offer does the persuasion for you
- outcome... the promise that aligns with the goal of the market (you promise change)
- timeframe... how long it takes to deply methodology to achieve outcome-result
- method... tangible clear methodology as to how the methodology and making it work
- secrets... your unique way of executing the mothodology and making it work (attach the method to us)
- safety net... risk reversal, a guarantee, a way to protect, feel safe and confident
- polarization... excluding people it isnt for to bring people it is even closer
- pricing... how much it costs to claim the offer and make it happen
- the (method) to (outcome) in (timeframe) with-out (polarizing) even if (safety) ((secret))
- you can present offer in 3 forms (level of details)
2. long form... (long title of your offer)
3. pitch... explain the outcome, methodology and terms-guarantees
- the harder to make the product, the easier to get clients
- great offers are built on great products
- you... I have an ungodly amount of confidence in the product
- spend 80% of time building your product and 20% telling people about it
- if you cant, improve your skill
- people buy products because they believe that what they are getting in value is superior to price.
- use the right words, images, phrases, to resonate with the prospect unconciuos mind
- know what the niche want to hear
- gather as much info about your market as possible
- list out 10 latent conditions that drive your market
system... inputs -> processes -> outputs -> feedback -> inputs
- genotypes are determined by variation (random mutation)
- scale... when system produce good output
- reproduction... when stimulus works so well we use it as model for new stimuli
- fitness... when stimulus is in KPI
- adaptability... when stimulus well adapted to latent conditions
- traits... traits of a stimulus (long form, short form)
- genotypes... the core variables of the stimulus
- variations... random or calculated iterations or changes
- genotypes... strings of variables that make the stimulus
- loom email... email, loom script, delivery
- it all comes down to variables
- design the sistem to create stimuli with 2-4 variables max
- find the right combination of variables
- the variables of a stimulus manifests traits
- adaptability... traits adapt to the environment
- examples... layers dont like humor as trait as approach
- fitness... how much the system is within KPI
- lvr subjectline, body copy, offer, loom thumbnail, loom title, followup emails
- prr loom script, loom delivery, case studies, cta
- abr prr variables, followup process, omnichannel following, reply style
- if stimulus is not in KPI, tweek variables
- dont scale until fitness in KPI
- the best client acquisition experts are just the best scientists
- you can iterate your way to anything
- what are the 2-4 key variable for this stimulus
- ex. video call message... content, cta, delivery
- ex. loom video on cold email... 30 looms view (include follow-up)
- ex. video cold message... 30 video view (include follow-up)
- how long you will run the experiment
- how much delay you will give the system
- ask yourself what could go wrong
- ex. email marketing... spam for deliverability
- part of a system that is not changed while the experiment is running
- ex. profile headline, bio, time of day posting, etc.
1 what was the conversion rate for the primary and secondary metrics
2 what was the KPI for the primary and secondary metrics
3 were you above or just slightly below KPI of secondary metric... by how much
- if 3 is yes, change nothing and scale
4 were you above or just slightly below KPI of primary metric... by how much
- if 4 is yes, change nothing and move to next stimulus
5 is primary conversion rate way below kpi
- usually you start here, in this case invert all the traits
- its very likely you wont get positive kpi the first time
- depending on how far off you are from kpi
- meaninig... all the other things staying the same
- if you have a winner, run it and dont mess with it
- think this, if you had the cure for cancer, would you mess with it
- find working varables for one stimulus and test it in other parts of system
- ex stimulus... subject line, first email line, etc.
- micro action chain... action > action > action > etc.
- strategy... the way you contruct a system combining stimulus
- fundamentals... ideas and principles guiding the strategy
--- Stimulus and Strategy Hunters vs. Fundamentals Seekers ---
- maybe serve both at the same time (theory plus recipes)
- all stimuli die with time (ex. ad fatigue)
- if you look like someone who fuck your client over before
- they will categorize you as a fraud too
- be different and dont look like others
- or a lot of time has to pass and people forget
- 95% of people are monkey see, monkey do
- do the opposite of everyone else cyclically
- paradigm... is the way you see something
- systems are named by their functions
- inputs... raw materials, input into a system
- processes... things that convert inputs in outputs
- output... end product of a system
- feedback... information given by the outputs to feed back into inputs
- environment... where the system operates in
- inputs... humans in your niche (typically strangers)
- processes... chain of stimuli designed to elicit a micro-action-chain
deployed by standard operating procedures (SOPs) or automation
- lead quality is not as crucial as you may think
- metrics we use to understand and improve the system
- sum of all client acquisition micro-actions equals
macro-action of deciding to become a client
- a stimuli is deployed using sops and automation
- rules and conditions the system must abide to
- darwin... its not the strongest who survive
but the one who best adapt to the environment
- a sub system (micro system) is a component of the macro system
6. get closed deals from primed prospects
- each sub-system has its own inputs, processes, etc.
- the environment is common between sub-systems
- latent condition > attention > interest > appointments > show > primed prospect > clesed deal
- main process equals sum of sub-processes
- throughput... value, the conversion of inputs into outputs
- bottlenecks... points in the system where the throughput becomes restricted
- latency... time elapsed between inputs being inputted and output being outputted
- the goal is to fix as many bottlenecks as possible
- the most important thing to understand
- without metrics, theres no way you build a working system
- you solve bottlenecks only with metrics
- you only make good decisions if you have good data
- you must log data outputted by the system
- conversion rate... output divided by input * 100 equal conversion rate (CR%)
- kpi give us a goal and something to optimize the system towards
- before building a system, set the kpi
- is the key metric to optimize your entire system on (sub-systems)
- ex sub-system to youtube appointment booking, appointement booking rate (not watch time)
- if you have a system with polaris in kpi, you should not fuck with the system
- ex increasing in open rate is not equal in increasing in appointment booking rate
- a change in one part of the system can drastically affect other parts of the system
that are seemingly unrelated to it
- if system is out of kpi, identily bottlenecks
- conversion rate... system input to output
- sub-conversion rate... conv rate of steps in a sub-system
1. defin the chain of stimuli and the input-output order of the sub-sub-sub-systems
2. calculate the sub-conversion rates between the stimuli (output div input * 100)
- keep a log of the fucking metrics
- you need a large dataset to get the mean
- ex you need to throw a coin 1000 times to get around 500-500 head-tail distribution
- ex in sales you may need 100 no before 1 yes
- increase the number of humans that can pass through your system
- first establish the proof of concept (system in kpi), then scale
- if you dont know how to scale things, study viruses
- you cant scale forever, theres a cap
- ex how many human you can reach that have the right latent condition in your niche
- increase inputs does not always equal increase output
- ex more email may send you to spam
- all systems require constant iteration and new testing to stay alive
- if you have a system thats working, dont fuck with it
- outputs of the system feed into the inputs
- you dont change something because of someones opinion, you use data
- because of latency, feedback is delayed in client acquisition systems
- if you want to build a successful client acquisition system, you must give it time
- be willing to spend months, if not years
- in sales is more about what NOT to do, not what to do
- reason... power of the mind to link, understand and form judgements logically
- rationality... being based on or in accordance with reason or logic
- predisposed inclination towards one thing, or away from another
- the more bias you have, the more you polarize and increase the bias
- pain, desperation, suffering, unhappiness, fear, anxiety, panic, sadness, hate
- pleasure, freedom, joy, happiness, confidence, love, over-the-moonness
- biggest problem in sales is emotions
- the bigger the expectation, the bigger the delusion
- when you create an hypothesis, dont get emotionally attached to it
- dont be emotional about something or you will take irrational action
anger, fear, confidence, surprise, sadness, joy, excitement, hoplessness, anxious,
panicked, stressed, bitter, insulted, frustrated, delighted, bored, annoyed, envy, etc.
- never make a decision when an emotion is present
- if you got a bad experience in the past, dont let it hunt you down
- dont assume people share your own beliefs
- dont expect people to see the world like you do
- break the entire client acquisition journey into micro-action-chain steps
- a stimulus that can actually trigger the action you wont
- effectiveness is no 1 or 0, is a percentage %
- all stimulus must perform good, if one doesnt it will sabotage everything else
- how to find good stimuli (not luck)
- its all about cause and effect, test-test-test
- humans in your niche determine of a stimulus
- leverage the heuristics (qualities, algorithms) of the mind
- if you want to open the door, you need the right key
- a very specific combination of variables give the result
- the lock determines the key, not the other way around
- heuristics allow us to predict how people will behave
- a heuristic is a pre-programmed quality of the mind
- we can shape and forge out stimuli to fit the mind by building it to take advantage
of the heuristics shared by the human population
- heuristics are used by the body to save energy, the brain cant afford to process
all info in a concious way, it needs a lot of shortcuts in the unconscious
1. reward super-response tendency (incentives) (strong offer, genuine results)
